name: bell pepper production, open field | bell pepper | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19732/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of fresh Capsicum during September, 2015-July, 2016 at a farm located in village Vadner Bhairav, District Nashik of Maharashtra. The farmer has reported a yield of 81,250 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle which has been cross-checked with yield potential of 80-100 t/ha (http://www.agrifarming.in/capsicum-farming). Sowing date for the crop is 14-Feburary, 2016 and harvesting date is 16-July, 2016. Mineral NPK fertilizer input is 197.50-459.63-137.25 kg/ha. Micro-macro nutrients applied are Ca 32.90, Zn 0.42, Borax 13.45, Manganese sulfate 1.41, Portafer 0.47, and Sulfite 0.77 kg per ha. Organic fertilizer applied amounts to 25,000 kg of homemade compost. Fungicide used has active ingredients Difenoconazol (562.5 g/ha), Carbendazin (4500 g/ha), Clorothilonil (5062.5 g/ha). Insecticide used has active ingredient as Dichlorovos (3135 g/ha, proxy used Dichlorovos DDVP). Other pesticides used is plant based horticultural oil Neemazol (7.13 kg/ha). Machinery is used only for plant protection with fuel consumption of 15.60 kg/ha on spraying, and for soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 18.30 kg/ha using plough (20% consumption) and rotary cultivator (80% consumption) for soil tillage.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

This activity starts about four weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in mid- September and sowing was done about five months after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 5 months.


The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature Capsicum from the Capsicum plant
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0128:Growing of spices, aromatic, drug and pharmaceutical crops

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 15-September, 2015; Harvesting date main crop: 16-July, 2016. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. Total time from date of sowing to date of harvesting comes to 153 days.  The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Capsicum follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmer does not maintain any written records and has provided the data from recent memory. In this region, typically farmers are unable to provide exact name of active ingredient in the pesticide they use and the same was noted from details given on the pesticide packet. Individual farmer is not able to calculate fuel consumption for his own farm alone and this information has been collected from farming community of the area.

exchanges.description: Calculated Value. This value has been calculated by using the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production.

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of bell pepper is calculated to be circa 3.75E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'benzimidazole-compound', 'borax, anhydrous, powder', 'chlorothalonil', 'cyclic N-compound', 'manganese sulfate', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified', 'portafer', 'sulfite', 'zinc monosulfate'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 7.50E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'bell pepper' is calculated to be circa 1.08E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'lime', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate rock, as P2O5, beneficiated, dry', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.16E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
